longdescription.p: Gentoo/FreeBSD (or Gentoo/FBSD, or G/FBSD) is an effort to create a complete FreeBSD-based Gentoo system, sharing the complete administration facilities of Gentoo with the reliability of the FreeBSD kernel and userland.
An experimental, yet incomplete release have been done, and it's possible to install Gentoo/FreeBSD following the install guide.
This project is still in its infancy. If you are interested in working on it, please send an email to the Gentoo/*BSD team.
To be a complete Gentoo system, Gentoo/FreeBSD must be installed with stages that carries the minimum software neede to run the system.

milestone.description: First experimental stage3 for basic installation

longdescription.p: To install the stage, a LiveCD is needed, right now the FreeSBIE LiveCD can be used, but it's needed a pure Gentoo/FreeBSD LiveCD for a complete release.
The current init system used for Gentoo/FreeBSD is based off an old Linux version of baselayout. A newer baselayout is needed to be in sync with Gentoo/Linux.

task.name: GNOME porting
task.description: Porting of FreeBSD's patches for GNOME

longdescription.p: GNOME needs to be heavily patched to run on FreeBSD. Most of the patches are available on FreeBSD's ports, but needs to be ported, cleaned up and sent upstream.
